author: Lego77Loco
title: Great Culture Lego Kit
review:
I very enjoyed the designs of this set. Nice selection of colors and stylish creations. The mini figures with this set are great and blend perfectly with similar sets that go with this one.

Is very easy to build and makes great addition for my Lego Capital town.

author: BelgianBricker
title: dance baby dance
review:
I simply loved the look of this set and its bigger brother 80105, so I simply had to get this. Now that I have it, I am very pleased with it, but I am not wowed.

The build: 

The build is quite straight-forward. There aren't any too overly complex techniques being used, and I am pretty sure that even the most average builder will have no problem whatsoever putting this set together. 
Although there is a lot of repetition (the 5 dragons and temple-arches), the instructions are made in such a way that the building process never becomes to overly boring. For example: the dragons are not all build together and the small differences in their head-design makes sure you have to keep your attention to what you are doing instead of turning to auto-buildpilot :)

The model:

Wow! Very nice. The dragons look amazing The temple-archway looks amazing, although it is very thin, there is not a lot af depth present. The stage is superb. The drumband is lovely. 

The dragons don't have a lot of articulation, but what is there is sufficient: their heads can move up and down a bit, the lower jaws open up and the legs are posable. It is enough to make sure you can create some sense of movement and some interesting ways to showcase the dragons on their stage.

Parts:

Maybe the best...euhm...part :)
No stickers! Nicely printed pieces, although the white prints still have the old problem of them being not white but showing through the colours underneath.
Many new parts in unusual colours, many gold-coloured pieces, many recolours etc... this is a dream come true for many AFOLS.
I don't see a lot of value here for MOC-builders for the simple reason that the printed pieces are not generic enough, they are very specific to the eastern theme.

Overall:

Good, but not amazing.
